mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, John Parke Custis to George Washington, 1779 August 11
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Custis, John Parke, 1754-1781
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Requests George Washington's advice whether to sell Eastern shore lands because of heavy taxes and can get no one to live there & work them--rumors of truce to be offered by British King--appreciates Washington's advice on draining low grounds [at Abingdon] to prevent tidal floods--poor corn crops and depreciation of paper money--everyone paying old debts in paper money--purchase of Alexander's land--army's success at Stony Point. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783
